subject: Wheels
event: Had a great time last weekend at the Santa Fe Concorso, the biggest auto show in the southwest. I love old cars (our family never had enough money to own a car when I was a kid, so I walked and rode the bus and assembled plastic models of cars when other kids were building fighter planes), and there were some amazing ones on display. The best of show can be seen on the Concorso's website, here: http://santafeconcorso.com/about.html Beautiful cars, no doubt, though there were so many on display that I would have been hard pressed to pick if I had been a judge. I did take pictures of some of my own personal favorites. Those were all cool -- especially that 300SL Gullwing, a car I loved when it was only a plastic model on my desk in 1962. Got to love that Tucker too. I mean, hell, a Tucker. The BEST part of the weekend, though, was the Concorso invited me to exhibit my own new wheels, a custom-painted Tesla Model S. I am pleased to say that my Tesla was the hit of the electric car division (not that the Volt and the Leaf that flanked me provided much competition), and always seemed to have a curious crowd around it. FWIW, I bought the Tesla a couple of months ago, but with my recent trips to France, Switzerland, San Diego, Scotland, England, and LA, I have hardly had time to drive her. Something I am looking forward to doing over the next few months. But, yes, she's gorgeous, she's comfortable, and she goes like a bat out of hell. (And yes, I still have my old Mazda RX-7 too. What can I say? I hang on to things. And it won't be long until that RX-7 is old enough to count as an antique too).

comments.upictitle: what do we say to the god of death?: cersmirksei
comments.article: Must be nice. Givin' the Lannisters a run for their money with those wheels.

Badass rides all (including yours, truly a machine worthy of the name). Can't believe there was a Tucker there, they've fascinated me since I read about Leland Gaunt's Tucker Talisman in Stephen King's Needful Things (I know the Talisman was never actually made but still).

Question: what's the car in the third picture with eagle/hawk/whatever type bird for the hood ornament? Makes for one hell of a modern day sigil.

You ever consider collecting classic cars, give Clive Cussler a run for his money?
I believe that's this baby, a DuPont: http://fineartamerica.com/featured/1929-l<wbr />alique-glass-eagles-head-hood-ornament-j<wbr />ack-pumphrey.html
comments.subject: That hood ornament

comments.upictitle: the silver lady: spring bluebell woods by fluidic_icons
comments.article: Car shows are fun! Thanks for the pics. :) Would like to hear more abt the Tesla, when you have time.

I saw the Tesla at the 2014 Detroit auto show, and I can say sir that I am immensely jealous of your wheels.  Especially being that yours is purple.  The enormous touch screen blew my mind when I saw it at the auto show, sigh... If only they were cheaper.
comments.subject: Tesla

comments.article:
Glad to hear you are enjoying your new car. I have been a long-time fan myself (and shareholder, so extra thanks :-D)

The best way to store your battery for long periods of time is 50-60% full and plugged in all the time. Btw do you know of the book "Owning Model S" by Nick J. Howe? Lots of tips, tricks and troubleshooting advice from on of the best experts on the car.
I know nothing at all about cars except to enjoy admiring beautiful ones, and wow, those are all beautiful. And your Tesla! I have Tesla envy! Ai!
Wow. The older cars have much greater variety in appearance than modern ones do. Some of them remind me of super villains for some reason.
comments.subject: Old cars

comments.article: And I know they crashed one on purpose.  I'm betting the other two were destroyed in freeway accidents and none of them have in fact worn out through use.
comments.subject: 47 of the original 50 Tuckers are still on the road

comments.article: While modern cars are safer and more eco-friendly, there is just something special about the old ones made of chrome, leather, round headlamps and such. Sitting in one of those takes you back to another time. I wonder if future generations will feel the same nostalgia for present day cars.
That color is amazing! I've always wondered why there weren't more purple cars. I'd happily buy one!
Beautiful car!
Beautiful. Off-topic, but I just finished The Crofter and the Laird by John McPhee. Have you read it? A few echoes of the books (Queenscrown particularly.)
Your purple Tesla is pimp as hell!
Love the color of your Tesla - did they mix that for you or can anyone order it in purple? (That Gullwing is amazing.)
comments.subject: Purple People Eater

comments.article:
I really like the red one in the fourth picture and the cars in the third picture. I don't know much about cars, but I really like how those types of cars look. Definitely my favourite classic cars.

Your Tesla looks pretty rad (I know nothing about cars, but I like the colour purple, so there's that).

:)
comments.subject: Cool Cars :)

comments.article:
"I hang on to things" made me chuckle (as you sure don't hang on to main characters ;-) )

[really love that nobody is save btw]
comments.subject: "I hang on to things"

comments.article:
Not bad but a dragon would be much cooler.

There should be a dragon on the car, at least. And some kind of fire breathing device to scare off paparazzi... Just saying
comments.subject: Not bad but

comments.article: Love your Tesla and the color! You should get a roadster too George. For those not up to date on why Tesla's are so awesome, this little illustrated article kind of sums it up brilliantly: http://theoatmeal.com/comics/tesla .
comments.subject: Tesla = my dream car

comments.article: Love the Tesla, George! My next car will be electric. Of course it won't be a Tesla or even slightly cool but still electric it shall be!
comments.subject: Tesla

comments.article: Your car is beautiful! The colour is the exact right colour. I have heard a lot about Tesla cars. Now I see what all the fuss is about :)

Hi George,

Those vintage cars are certainly lovely to look at. And well maintained!

I'm told electric vehicles are extremely quiet. I've been a passenger in a hybrid and the silence was almost disturbing. A friend tells me some manufacturers of electric vehicles actually had to add a device to make a noise on purpose so the driver had some indication the vehicle was running. I suppose there could be a period of acclimation when making the switch from a combustion automobile to an electric automobile. How as your experience with the Tesla?

-- Ray
comments.subject: Electric Cars -- too quiet?

comments.article:
Yes, it is very quiet... but I like that.

When I want sound, I turn on the radio.
comments.subject: Re: Electric Cars -- too quiet?

comments.article: hi george, slightly off topic, but I and a number of users on Westeros have received several emails from amazon changing the delivery date of World of Ice and Fire abou 4-5 times. It was originally 28th October, then moved to 26th November and is now 8th December. do you happen to know anything about these delays or when we might be able to receive the book? really excited to see it. thanks
comments.subject: WOIAF delay

comments.article: So far as I know, the book is being released on October 28.  I know nothing about any delays.
comments.subject: Re: WOIAF delay

comments.article: But your Tesla is gorgeous.  Surprised it wasn't Jet Green or Giant Blue instead of Viking Purple.
comments.subject: I like old cars

comments.article:
I sure would love to own a Tesla Model S. It looks like THE ideal daily commuter vehicle. If only it were were within my price range. . . Let me know when you're upgrading to a newer model and I'll buy yours!

The only drawback I can see with that car is that it would be impossible to make good time on a road trip, what with a a range of less than 300 miles between charging. (My brother, father, and I have the propensity to do overnight straight shots across the U.S. when we choose to travel, stopping only for gas and a meal)

A Tesla and an RX-7? Now that's a nice mix. A roommate of mine in college had an RX-7 -- nothing felt faster... Plus being able to say "My engine has 3 total moving parts" is kind of fun. Someday I'm hoping to buy a Tesla of my own, but it's a few days out yet.

Great shots! Thanks for sharing!
